responsibilities: Lead, guide, and influence customers and team members throughout the DevOps journey.
Solve cloud-based solutions at scale using deep technical expertise.
Guide customers through transforming their business with cultural philosophies, practices, and tools.
Collaborate with customers and partners on key engagements.
Design and code modules for infrastructure, application, and processes.
Develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects.
Create white papers, author blogs, build demos, and other reusable collateral for customers.
Work with Solution Architects, Data Scientists, and Service Engineering teams.
Engage in remote delivery methods and onsite engagement, including travel to customer locations as needed.
qualifications: Hands-on experience of programming in languages such as Python, Ruby, Go, Swift, Java, .Net, C++, Node.js, or similar object-oriented language.
Experience with automating cloud native technologies, deploying applications, and provisioning infrastructure.
Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code, using CloudFormation, Terraform, CDK, or other tools.
Experience developing cloud native CI/CD workflows and tools, such as GitHub Actions, Jenkins, Bamboo, TeamCity, Code Deploy (AWS), and/or GitLab Pipelines.
Hands-on experience with microservices and distributed application architecture, such as containers, Kubernetes, and/or serverless technology.
Experience with the full software development lifecycle (SDLC) and delivery using Agile practices.
Experience with configuration management frameworks such as Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible in production environments.
Knowledge of code Version Control branching strategies.
Knowledge of IP networking, VPN's, DNS, load balancing, and firewall.
Experience with monitoring and log aggregation frameworks such as Kafka, Logstash, Splunk, ElastiSearch, and Kibana.
Knowledge of the DORA metrics and how they relate to the SDLC process.
Experience implementing and designing cloud native security concepts, DevSecOps, or MLOps.
Strong presentation, verbal communication, and written communications skills.
analysis:
The job responsibilities and skills listed do not explicitly mention Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs). The responsibilities focus on leading DevOps initiatives, solving cloud-based solutions, guiding customers through business transformations, and collaborating on technical projects. The skills required include programming in various languages, automating cloud technologies, developing CI/CD workflows, and working with microservices and distributed application architectures. There is also a focus on infrastructure as code, configuration management, and cloud native security concepts.

While there is a mention of working with Data Scientists, which could potentially involve AI-related tasks, there is no direct reference to Generative AI or language models. The job seems to be more focused on DevOps, cloud infrastructure, and software development practices rather than AI or language model development or deployment.

Therefore, based on the provided information, it does not appear that this job involves working with Generative AI or language models.
